trans-unit.source: Authorization Code Grant Flow
trans-unit.target: Authorization Code Grant Flow

trans-unit.source: Access to web APIs by native clients and websites in Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) is implemented by using the OAuth 2.0 <newTerm>Authorization Code Grant</newTerm> flow.
trans-unit.target: Access to web APIs by native clients and websites in Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) is implemented by using the OAuth 2.0 <newTerm>Authorization Code Grant</newTerm> flow.

trans-unit.source: In this flow, the user delegates access to a client application.
trans-unit.target: In this flow, the user delegates access to a client application.

trans-unit.source: The transaction is protected and mediated by a code grant, which is exchanged for an access token.
trans-unit.target: The transaction is protected and mediated by a code grant, which is exchanged for an access token.

trans-unit.source: The client application never sees the user's credentials and the user agent never sees the access token.
trans-unit.target: The client application never sees the user's credentials and the user agent never sees the access token.

trans-unit.source: The standard Authorization Code Grant flow is described in Section 4.1 of the <externalLink><linkText>The OAuth 2.0 Authorization Framework</linkText><linkUri>http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6749</linkUri></externalLink>This diagram shows how the Authorization Code Grant Flow works in Azure AD.
trans-unit.target: The standard Authorization Code Grant flow is described in Section 4.1 of the <externalLink><linkText>The OAuth 2.0 Authorization Framework</linkText><linkUri>http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6749</linkUri></externalLink>This diagram shows how the Authorization Code Grant Flow works in Azure AD.

trans-unit.source: Authorization Code Grant Flow Diagram
trans-unit.target: Authorization Code Grant Flow Diagram

trans-unit.source: The following diagram illustrates the Authorization Code Grant flow.
trans-unit.target: The following diagram illustrates the Authorization Code Grant flow.

trans-unit.source: The client application starts the flow by redirecting the user agent to the Azure AD authorization endpoint.
trans-unit.target: The client application starts the flow by redirecting the user agent to the Azure AD authorization endpoint.

trans-unit.source: The user authenticates and consents, if consent is required.
trans-unit.target: The user authenticates and consents, if consent is required.

trans-unit.source: The Azure AD authorization endpoint redirects the user agent back to the client application with an authorization code.
trans-unit.target: The Azure AD authorization endpoint redirects the user agent back to the client application with an authorization code.

trans-unit.source: The user agent returns authorization code to the client application’s redirect URI.
trans-unit.target: The user agent returns authorization code to the client application’s redirect URI.

trans-unit.source: The client application requests an access token from the Azure AD token issuance endpoint.
trans-unit.target: The client application requests an access token from the Azure AD token issuance endpoint.

trans-unit.source: It presents the authorization code to prove that the user has consented.
trans-unit.target: It presents the authorization code to prove that the user has consented.

trans-unit.source: The Azure AD token issuance endpoint returns an access token and a refresh token.
trans-unit.target: The Azure AD token issuance endpoint returns an access token and a refresh token.

trans-unit.source: The refresh token can be used to request additional access tokens.
trans-unit.target: The refresh token can be used to request additional access tokens.

trans-unit.source: The client application uses the access token to authenticate to the Web API.
trans-unit.target: The client application uses the access token to authenticate to the Web API.

trans-unit.source: After authenticating the client application, the web API returns the requested data.
trans-unit.target: After authenticating the client application, the web API returns the requested data.

trans-unit.source: Register the Application in Azure AD
trans-unit.target: Register the Application in Azure AD

trans-unit.source: To begin, use the Azure Management Portal to register the application in your Azure AD tenant.
trans-unit.target: To begin, use the Azure Management Portal to register the application in your Azure AD tenant.

trans-unit.source: For detailed instructions, see <externalLink><linkText>Adding, Updating, and Removing an App</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=391831</linkUri></externalLink>
trans-unit.target: For detailed instructions, see <externalLink><linkText>Adding, Updating, and Removing an App</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=391831</linkUri></externalLink>

trans-unit.source: Request an authorization code
trans-unit.target: Request an authorization code

trans-unit.source: Next, the application prompts the user to authenticate to Azure AD and to allow Azure AD to release an authorization code to the application.
trans-unit.target: Next, the application prompts the user to authenticate to Azure AD and to allow Azure AD to release an authorization code to the application.

trans-unit.source: The application presents the authorization code to an authorization server and the authorization server returns an access token that gives the application permission to access the resource.
trans-unit.target: The application presents the authorization code to an authorization server and the authorization server returns an access token that gives the application permission to access the resource.

trans-unit.source: To get the authorization code, the web browser (or an embedded web browser control) navigates to a tenant-specific or common (tenant-independent) endpoint.
trans-unit.target: To get the authorization code, the web browser (or an embedded web browser control) navigates to a tenant-specific or common (tenant-independent) endpoint.

trans-unit.source: If the user is part of an organization, an administrator of the organization can consent or decline on the user's behalf, or permit the user to consent.
trans-unit.target: If the user is part of an organization, an administrator of the organization can consent or decline on the user's behalf, or permit the user to consent.

trans-unit.source: The user is given the option to consent only when the administrator permits it.
trans-unit.target: The user is given the option to consent only when the administrator permits it.

trans-unit.source: Authorization Code Request
trans-unit.target: Authorization Code Request

trans-unit.source: To request an authorization code for access to a resource, create an OAuth 2.0 GET request, like this one:
trans-unit.target: To request an authorization code for access to a resource, create an OAuth 2.0 GET request, like this one:

trans-unit.source: For example:
trans-unit.target: For example:

trans-unit.source: The following table describes the valid parameters in the request.
trans-unit.target: The following table describes the valid parameters in the request.

trans-unit.source: Parameter
trans-unit.target: Parameter

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: [Required] Specifies the client id of the application that is registered in Azure Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: [Required] Specifies the client id of the application that is registered in Azure Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: To find the application's client ID, in the <externalLink><linkText>Azure Management Portal</linkText><linkUri>https://manage.WindowsAzure.com</linkUri></externalLink>, click <ui>Active Directory</ui>, click the directory, click the application and then click <ui>Configure</ui>.
trans-unit.target: To find the application's client ID, in the <externalLink><linkText>Azure Management Portal</linkText><linkUri>https://manage.WindowsAzure.com</linkUri></externalLink>, click <ui>Active Directory</ui>, click the directory, click the application and then click <ui>Configure</ui>.

trans-unit.source: [Optional] Provides a hint about the tenant or domain that the user should use to sign in.
trans-unit.target: [Optional] Provides a hint about the tenant or domain that the user should use to sign in.

trans-unit.source: The value of the <parameterReference>domain_hint</parameterReference> is a registered domain for the tenant.
trans-unit.target: The value of the <parameterReference>domain_hint</parameterReference> is a registered domain for the tenant.

trans-unit.source: If the tenant is federated to an on-premises directory, AAD redirects to the specified tenant federation server.
trans-unit.target: If the tenant is federated to an on-premises directory, AAD redirects to the specified tenant federation server.

trans-unit.source: [Optional] Provides a hint to the user on the sign-in page.
trans-unit.target: [Optional] Provides a hint to the user on the sign-in page.

trans-unit.source: For example, this value is pre-filled in the username field on the sign-in page.
trans-unit.target: For example, this value is pre-filled in the username field on the sign-in page.

trans-unit.source: [Optional] Indicate the type of user interaction that is required.
trans-unit.target: [Optional] Indicate the type of user interaction that is required.

trans-unit.source: Valid values are:
trans-unit.target: Valid values are:

trans-unit.source: -- <parameterReference>login</parameterReference>: The user should be prompted to re-authenticate.-- <parameterReference>consent</parameterReference>: User consent has been granted, but needs to be updated.
trans-unit.target: -- <parameterReference>login</parameterReference>: The user should be prompted to re-authenticate.-- <parameterReference>consent</parameterReference>: User consent has been granted, but needs to be updated.

trans-unit.source: The user should be prompted to consent.
trans-unit.target: The user should be prompted to consent.

trans-unit.source: -- <parameterReference>admin_consent</parameterReference>: An administrator should be prompted to consent on behalf of all users in their organization.
trans-unit.target: -- <parameterReference>admin_consent</parameterReference>: An administrator should be prompted to consent on behalf of all users in their organization.

trans-unit.source: [Recommended] Specifies the reply URL of the application.
trans-unit.target: [Recommended] Specifies the reply URL of the application.

trans-unit.source: To find the application's reply URL, in the <externalLink><linkText>Azure Management Portal</linkText><linkUri>https://manage.WindowsAzure.com</linkUri></externalLink>, click <ui>Active Directory</ui>, click the directory, and then click the application and then click <ui>Configure</ui>.
trans-unit.target: To find the application's reply URL, in the <externalLink><linkText>Azure Management Portal</linkText><linkUri>https://manage.WindowsAzure.com</linkUri></externalLink>, click <ui>Active Directory</ui>, click the directory, and then click the application and then click <ui>Configure</ui>.

trans-unit.source: The <system>Reply URL</system> field is in the <ui>Single Sign-on</ui> section of the <ui>Configure</ui> page.
trans-unit.target: The <system>Reply URL</system> field is in the <ui>Single Sign-on</ui> section of the <ui>Configure</ui> page.

trans-unit.source: [Optional] The App ID URI of the web API (secured resource).
trans-unit.target: [Optional] The App ID URI of the web API (secured resource).

trans-unit.source: To find the App ID URI of the web API, in the <externalLink><linkText>Azure Management Portal</linkText><linkUri>https://manage.WindowsAzure.com</linkUri></externalLink>, click <ui>Active Directory</ui>, click the directory, click the application and then click <ui>Configure</ui>.
trans-unit.target: To find the App ID URI of the web API, in the <externalLink><linkText>Azure Management Portal</linkText><linkUri>https://manage.WindowsAzure.com</linkUri></externalLink>, click <ui>Active Directory</ui>, click the directory, click the application and then click <ui>Configure</ui>.

trans-unit.source: [Required] Specifies the requested response type.
trans-unit.target: [Required] Specifies the requested response type.

trans-unit.source: In an authorization code grant request, the value must be <system>code</system>.
trans-unit.target: In an authorization code grant request, the value must be <system>code</system>.

trans-unit.source: [Recommended] A randomly generated non-reused value that is sent in the request and returned in the response.
trans-unit.target: [Recommended] A randomly generated non-reused value that is sent in the request and returned in the response.

trans-unit.source: This parameter is used as a mitigation against cross-site request forgery (CSRF) attacks.
trans-unit.target: This parameter is used as a mitigation against cross-site request forgery (CSRF) attacks.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="12a33bb0-247c-460b-bb55-f5d1e699b1e7" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Best Practices for OAuth 2.0 in Azure AD</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="12a33bb0-247c-460b-bb55-f5d1e699b1e7" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Best Practices for OAuth 2.0 in Azure AD</link>.

trans-unit.source: Examples
trans-unit.target: Examples

trans-unit.source: The following are examples of valid GET requests for an authorization code.
trans-unit.target: The following are examples of valid GET requests for an authorization code.

trans-unit.source: In this request, the application with <parameterReference>client_id</parameterReference> 2d4d11a2-f814-46a7-890a-274a72a7309e requests an authorization code.
trans-unit.target: In this request, the application with <parameterReference>client_id</parameterReference> 2d4d11a2-f814-46a7-890a-274a72a7309e requests an authorization code.

trans-unit.source: The authorization code will be used to request a token for the web API with the resource identifierhttps://service.contoso.com/.
trans-unit.target: The authorization code will be used to request a token for the web API with the resource identifierhttps://service.contoso.com/.

trans-unit.source: Because the expected user is admin@contoso.com, this value used in a <parameterReference>login_hint</parameterReference> that is prefilled in username field on the sign-in page.
trans-unit.target: Because the expected user is admin@contoso.com, this value used in a <parameterReference>login_hint</parameterReference> that is prefilled in username field on the sign-in page.

trans-unit.source: The <parameterReference>redirect_uri</parameterReference> value in the request is the registered redirect URI for the application.
trans-unit.target: The <parameterReference>redirect_uri</parameterReference> value in the request is the registered redirect URI for the application.

trans-unit.source: When the application runs on the user’s device and is not hosted on a website, the redirect URI does not need to be a physical endpoint.
trans-unit.target: When the application runs on the user’s device and is not hosted on a website, the redirect URI does not need to be a physical endpoint.

trans-unit.source: The following example is similar to the previous one, but it uses the <parameterReference>domain_hint</parameterReference> parameter to suggest a domain and the <parameterReference>prompt</parameterReference> parameter to specify a consent prompt.
trans-unit.target: The following example is similar to the previous one, but it uses the <parameterReference>domain_hint</parameterReference> parameter to suggest a domain and the <parameterReference>prompt</parameterReference> parameter to specify a consent prompt.

trans-unit.source: Authorization Code Response
trans-unit.target: Authorization Code Response

trans-unit.source: When an application sends a GET request for an authorization code, Azure AD sends a response to the value of the <parameterReference>redirect_uri</parameterReference> parameter in the request.
trans-unit.target: When an application sends a GET request for an authorization code, Azure AD sends a response to the value of the <parameterReference>redirect_uri</parameterReference> parameter in the request.

trans-unit.source: The response includes the following parameters.
trans-unit.target: The response includes the following parameters.

trans-unit.source: Parameter
trans-unit.target: Parameter

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: admin_consent
trans-unit.target: admin_consent

trans-unit.source: The value is True if an administrator consented to a consent request prompt.
trans-unit.target: The value is True if an administrator consented to a consent request prompt.

trans-unit.source: code
trans-unit.target: code

trans-unit.source: The authorization code that the application requested.
trans-unit.target: The authorization code that the application requested.

trans-unit.source: The application can use the authorization code to request an access token for the target resource.
trans-unit.target: The application can use the authorization code to request an access token for the target resource.

trans-unit.source: session_state
trans-unit.target: session_state

trans-unit.source: A unique value that identifies the current user session.
trans-unit.target: A unique value that identifies the current user session.

trans-unit.source: This value is a GUID, but should be treated as an opaque value that is passed without examination.
trans-unit.target: This value is a GUID, but should be treated as an opaque value that is passed without examination.

trans-unit.source: state
trans-unit.target: state

trans-unit.source: If a state parameter is included in the request, the same value should appear in the response.
trans-unit.target: If a state parameter is included in the request, the same value should appear in the response.

trans-unit.source: The application should verify that the state values in the request and response are identical.
trans-unit.target: The application should verify that the state values in the request and response are identical.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="12a33bb0-247c-460b-bb55-f5d1e699b1e7" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Best Practices for OAuth 2.0 in Azure AD</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="12a33bb0-247c-460b-bb55-f5d1e699b1e7" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Best Practices for OAuth 2.0 in Azure AD</link>.

trans-unit.source: The following is a sample response to an authorization code request.
trans-unit.target: The following is a sample response to an authorization code request.

trans-unit.source: The location header value matches the <parameterReference>redirect_uri</parameterReference> value in the request.
trans-unit.target: The location header value matches the <parameterReference>redirect_uri</parameterReference> value in the request.

trans-unit.source: If the <parameterReference>state</parameterReference> value in the response matches the <parameterReference>state</parameterReference> value in the request, the application should store the authorization code for use in the access token request.
trans-unit.target: If the <parameterReference>state</parameterReference> value in the response matches the <parameterReference>state</parameterReference> value in the request, the application should store the authorization code for use in the access token request.

trans-unit.source: Use the Authorization Code to Request an Access Token
trans-unit.target: Use the Authorization Code to Request an Access Token

trans-unit.source: When the application gets the authorization code from the authorization endpoint, it can use the authorization code to request an access token from Azure AD.
trans-unit.target: When the application gets the authorization code from the authorization endpoint, it can use the authorization code to request an access token from Azure AD.

trans-unit.source: Access Token Request
trans-unit.target: Access Token Request

trans-unit.source: To redeem an authorization code and get an access token, sent an HTTP POST request to a common or tenant-specific Azure AD Authorization endpoint.
trans-unit.target: To redeem an authorization code and get an access token, sent an HTTP POST request to a common or tenant-specific Azure AD Authorization endpoint.

trans-unit.source: The following parameters are valid in a token request.
trans-unit.target: The following parameters are valid in a token request.

trans-unit.source: Parameter
trans-unit.target: Parameter

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: client_id
trans-unit.target: client_id

trans-unit.source: [Required] The client ID of the native client application.
trans-unit.target: [Required] The client ID of the native client application.

trans-unit.source: To find the application's client ID, in the <externalLink><linkText>Azure Management Portal</linkText><linkUri>https://manage.WindowsAzure.com</linkUri></externalLink>, click <ui>Active Directory</ui>, click the directory, click the application and then click <ui>Configure</ui>.
trans-unit.target: To find the application's client ID, in the <externalLink><linkText>Azure Management Portal</linkText><linkUri>https://manage.WindowsAzure.com</linkUri></externalLink>, click <ui>Active Directory</ui>, click the directory, click the application and then click <ui>Configure</ui>.

trans-unit.source: client_secret
trans-unit.target: client_secret

trans-unit.source: [Required for confidential clients (websites)] Contains the client password.
trans-unit.target: [Required for confidential clients (websites)] Contains the client password.

trans-unit.source: code
trans-unit.target: code

trans-unit.source: [Required] The authorization code from the <link xlink:href="aeab0a46-4da1-4300-be9c-3be418f07a5b#BKMK_authorization_code_response" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Authorization Code Response</link>.
trans-unit.target: [Required] The authorization code from the <link xlink:href="aeab0a46-4da1-4300-be9c-3be418f07a5b#BKMK_authorization_code_response" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Authorization Code Response</link>.

trans-unit.source: grant_type
trans-unit.target: grant_type

trans-unit.source: [Required] Indicated the type of grant you are using.
trans-unit.target: [Required] Indicated the type of grant you are using.

trans-unit.source: For an authorization code grant, the value is <system>authorization_code</system>.
trans-unit.target: For an authorization code grant, the value is <system>authorization_code</system>.

trans-unit.source: redirect_uri
trans-unit.target: redirect_uri

trans-unit.source: [Required if it was included in the authorization code request] Specifies the reply URL of the application.
trans-unit.target: [Required if it was included in the authorization code request] Specifies the reply URL of the application.

trans-unit.source: The value must match the value of the <parameterReference>redirect_uri</parameterReference> parameter in the authorization code request.
trans-unit.target: The value must match the value of the <parameterReference>redirect_uri</parameterReference> parameter in the authorization code request.

trans-unit.source: To find the application's reply URL, in the <externalLink><linkText>Azure Management Portal</linkText><linkUri>https://manage.WindowsAzure.com</linkUri></externalLink>, click <ui>Active Directory</ui>, click the directory, click the application, and then click <ui>Configure</ui>.
trans-unit.target: To find the application's reply URL, in the <externalLink><linkText>Azure Management Portal</linkText><linkUri>https://manage.WindowsAzure.com</linkUri></externalLink>, click <ui>Active Directory</ui>, click the directory, click the application, and then click <ui>Configure</ui>.

trans-unit.source: resource
trans-unit.target: resource

trans-unit.source: [Optional] The App ID URI of the web API (secured resource).
trans-unit.target: [Optional] The App ID URI of the web API (secured resource).

trans-unit.source: To find the App ID URI, in the <externalLink><linkText>Azure Management Portal</linkText><linkUri>https://manage.WindowsAzure.com</linkUri></externalLink>, click <ui>Active Directory</ui>, click the directory, click the application, and then click <ui>Configure</ui>.
trans-unit.target: To find the App ID URI, in the <externalLink><linkText>Azure Management Portal</linkText><linkUri>https://manage.WindowsAzure.com</linkUri></externalLink>, click <ui>Active Directory</ui>, click the directory, click the application, and then click <ui>Configure</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Example
trans-unit.target: Example

trans-unit.source: The following HTTP POST request includes all required parameters and the optional resource parameter.
trans-unit.target: The following HTTP POST request includes all required parameters and the optional resource parameter.

trans-unit.source: Access Token Response
trans-unit.target: Access Token Response

trans-unit.source: The response to a request for an access token includes the following parameters.
trans-unit.target: The response to a request for an access token includes the following parameters.

trans-unit.source: Parameter
trans-unit.target: Parameter

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: access_token
trans-unit.target: access_token

trans-unit.source: The requested access token.
trans-unit.target: The requested access token.

trans-unit.source: The application can use this token to authenticate to the secured resource, such as a web API.
trans-unit.target: The application can use this token to authenticate to the secured resource, such as a web API.

trans-unit.source: expires_in
trans-unit.target: expires_in

trans-unit.source: How long the access token is valid (in seconds).
trans-unit.target: How long the access token is valid (in seconds).

trans-unit.source: expires_on
trans-unit.target: expires_on

trans-unit.source: The time when the access token expires.
trans-unit.target: The time when the access token expires.

trans-unit.source: The date is represented as the number of seconds from
trans-unit.target: The date is represented as the number of seconds from

trans-unit.source: 1970-01-01T0:0:0Z UTC until the expiration time.
trans-unit.target: 1970-01-01T0:0:0Z UTC until the expiration time.

trans-unit.source: This value is used to determine the lifetime of cached tokens.
trans-unit.target: This value is used to determine the lifetime of cached tokens.

trans-unit.source: id_token
trans-unit.target: id_token

trans-unit.source: An unsigned JSON Web Token (JWT).
trans-unit.target: An unsigned JSON Web Token (JWT).

trans-unit.source: The application can use this token to request information about the user who consented.
trans-unit.target: The application can use this token to request information about the user who consented.

trans-unit.source: The application can cache the values and display them.
trans-unit.target: The application can cache the values and display them.

trans-unit.source: refresh_token
trans-unit.target: refresh_token

trans-unit.source: An OAuth 2.0 refresh token.
trans-unit.target: An OAuth 2.0 refresh token.

trans-unit.source: The application can use this token acquire additional access tokens after the current access token expires.
trans-unit.target: The application can use this token acquire additional access tokens after the current access token expires.

trans-unit.source: resource
trans-unit.target: resource

trans-unit.source: The App ID URI of the web API (secured resource).
trans-unit.target: The App ID URI of the web API (secured resource).

trans-unit.source: scope
trans-unit.target: scope

trans-unit.source: Impersonation permissions granted to the client application.
trans-unit.target: Impersonation permissions granted to the client application.

trans-unit.source: The default permission is <system>user_impersonation</system>.
trans-unit.target: The default permission is <system>user_impersonation</system>.

trans-unit.source: The owner of the secured resource can register additional values in Azure AD.
trans-unit.target: The owner of the secured resource can register additional values in Azure AD.

trans-unit.source: token_type
trans-unit.target: token_type

trans-unit.source: Indicates the token type value.
trans-unit.target: Indicates the token type value.

trans-unit.source: The only type that Azure AD supports is <system>Bearer</system> For more information about bearer tokens, see <externalLink><linkText>The OAuth 2.0 Authorization Framework: Bearer Token Usage (RFC 6750).</linkText><linkUri>http://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc6750.txt</linkUri></externalLink>
trans-unit.target: The only type that Azure AD supports is <system>Bearer</system> For more information about bearer tokens, see <externalLink><linkText>The OAuth 2.0 Authorization Framework: Bearer Token Usage (RFC 6750).</linkText><linkUri>http://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc6750.txt</linkUri></externalLink>

trans-unit.source: The id_token parameter value is a JSON web token (JWT) that includes the following claim types.
trans-unit.target: The id_token parameter value is a JSON web token (JWT) that includes the following claim types.

trans-unit.source: For more information about JSON web tokens, see the JWT IETF draft specification at <externalLink><linkText>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=392344</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=392344</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about JSON web tokens, see the JWT IETF draft specification at <externalLink><linkText>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=392344</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=392344</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Claim type
trans-unit.target: Claim type

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: aud
trans-unit.target: aud

trans-unit.source: Audience of the token.
trans-unit.target: Audience of the token.

trans-unit.source: When the token is issued to a client application, the audience is the <parameterReference>client_id</parameterReference> of the client.
trans-unit.target: When the token is issued to a client application, the audience is the <parameterReference>client_id</parameterReference> of the client.

trans-unit.source: exp
trans-unit.target: exp

trans-unit.source: Expiration time.
trans-unit.target: Expiration time.

trans-unit.source: The time when the token expires.
trans-unit.target: The time when the token expires.

trans-unit.source: For the token to be valid, the current date/time must be less than or equal to the <system>exp</system> value.
trans-unit.target: For the token to be valid, the current date/time must be less than or equal to the <system>exp</system> value.

trans-unit.source: The time is represented as the number of seconds from January 1, 1970 (1970-01-01T0:0:0Z) UTC until the time the token was issued.
trans-unit.target: The time is represented as the number of seconds from January 1, 1970 (1970-01-01T0:0:0Z) UTC until the time the token was issued.

trans-unit.source: family_name
trans-unit.target: family_name

trans-unit.source: User’s last name or surname.
trans-unit.target: User’s last name or surname.

trans-unit.source: The application can display this value.
trans-unit.target: The application can display this value.

trans-unit.source: given_name
trans-unit.target: given_name

trans-unit.source: User’s first name.
trans-unit.target: User’s first name.

trans-unit.source: The application can display this value.
trans-unit.target: The application can display this value.

trans-unit.source: iat
trans-unit.target: iat

trans-unit.source: Issued at time.
trans-unit.target: Issued at time.

trans-unit.source: The time when the JWT was issued.
trans-unit.target: The time when the JWT was issued.

trans-unit.source: The time is represented as the number of seconds from January 1, 1970 (1970-01-01T0:0:0Z) UTC until the time the token was issued.
trans-unit.target: The time is represented as the number of seconds from January 1, 1970 (1970-01-01T0:0:0Z) UTC until the time the token was issued.

trans-unit.source: iss
trans-unit.target: iss

trans-unit.source: Identifies the token issuer
trans-unit.target: Identifies the token issuer

trans-unit.source: nbf
trans-unit.target: nbf

trans-unit.source: Not before time.
trans-unit.target: Not before time.

trans-unit.source: The time when the token becomes effective.
trans-unit.target: The time when the token becomes effective.

trans-unit.source: For the token to be valid, the current date/time must be greater than or equal to the Nbf value.
trans-unit.target: For the token to be valid, the current date/time must be greater than or equal to the Nbf value.

trans-unit.source: The time is represented as the number of seconds from January 1, 1970 (1970-01-01T0:0:0Z) UTC until the time the token was issued.
trans-unit.target: The time is represented as the number of seconds from January 1, 1970 (1970-01-01T0:0:0Z) UTC until the time the token was issued.

trans-unit.source: oid
trans-unit.target: oid

trans-unit.source: Object identifier (ID) of the user object in Azure AD.
trans-unit.target: Object identifier (ID) of the user object in Azure AD.

trans-unit.source: sub
trans-unit.target: sub

trans-unit.source: Token subject identifier.
trans-unit.target: Token subject identifier.

trans-unit.source: This is a persistent and immutable identifier for the user that the token describes.
trans-unit.target: This is a persistent and immutable identifier for the user that the token describes.

trans-unit.source: Use this value in caching logic.
trans-unit.target: Use this value in caching logic.

trans-unit.source: tid
trans-unit.target: tid

trans-unit.source: Tenant identifier (ID) of the Azure AD tenant that issued the token.
trans-unit.target: Tenant identifier (ID) of the Azure AD tenant that issued the token.

trans-unit.source: unique_name
trans-unit.target: unique_name

trans-unit.source: A unique identifier for that can be displayed to the user.
trans-unit.target: A unique identifier for that can be displayed to the user.

trans-unit.source: This is usually a user principal name (UPN).
trans-unit.target: This is usually a user principal name (UPN).

trans-unit.source: upn
trans-unit.target: upn

trans-unit.source: User principal name of the user.
trans-unit.target: User principal name of the user.

trans-unit.source: ver
trans-unit.target: ver

trans-unit.source: Version.
trans-unit.target: Version.

trans-unit.source: The version of the JWT token, typically 1.0.
trans-unit.target: The version of the JWT token, typically 1.0.

trans-unit.source: Example
trans-unit.target: Example

trans-unit.source: The following is a sample response to a request for an access token, when the token request includes an authorization code.
trans-unit.target: The following is a sample response to a request for an access token, when the token request includes an authorization code.

trans-unit.source: The JWT token in the value of the <parameterReference>id_token</parameterReference> parameter can be decoded into the following claims:
trans-unit.target: The JWT token in the value of the <parameterReference>id_token</parameterReference> parameter can be decoded into the following claims:

trans-unit.source: Use the Access Token to Access the Resource
trans-unit.target: Use the Access Token to Access the Resource

trans-unit.source: You can use the access token that is returned in the response to authenticate to a protected resources, such as a web API.
trans-unit.target: You can use the access token that is returned in the response to authenticate to a protected resources, such as a web API.

trans-unit.source: Typically, the token is presented to the web API in an HTTP request using the Bearer scheme, which is described in <externalLink><linkText>RFC 6750</linkText><linkUri>http://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc6750.txt</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: Typically, the token is presented to the web API in an HTTP request using the Bearer scheme, which is described in <externalLink><linkText>RFC 6750</linkText><linkUri>http://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc6750.txt</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: This specification explains how to use bearer tokens in HTTP requests to access protected resources.
trans-unit.target: This specification explains how to use bearer tokens in HTTP requests to access protected resources.

trans-unit.source: When the web API receives and validates the token, it gives the native client application access to the web API.
trans-unit.target: When the web API receives and validates the token, it gives the native client application access to the web API.

trans-unit.source: The following example shows a GET request that passes an access token in the request body.
trans-unit.target: The following example shows a GET request that passes an access token in the request body.

trans-unit.source: The Authorization header indicates that it is a bearer token, which is valid for anyone who possesses the token.
trans-unit.target: The Authorization header indicates that it is a bearer token, which is valid for anyone who possesses the token.

trans-unit.source: Use the Refresh Token to Request a New Access Token
trans-unit.target: Use the Refresh Token to Request a New Access Token

trans-unit.source: When an access token expires, the native client application can use the refresh token to get a new access token.
trans-unit.target: When an access token expires, the native client application can use the refresh token to get a new access token.

trans-unit.source: The lifetime of the refresh token is not provided and varies based on policy settings and the time when the authorization code grant is revoked by Azure AD.
trans-unit.target: The lifetime of the refresh token is not provided and varies based on policy settings and the time when the authorization code grant is revoked by Azure AD.

trans-unit.source: The application should expect and handle cases when the request for a new access token fails.
trans-unit.target: The application should expect and handle cases when the request for a new access token fails.

trans-unit.source: In that case, it should return to the code that requests a new access token.
trans-unit.target: In that case, it should return to the code that requests a new access token.

trans-unit.source: For details, see <link xlink:href="12a33bb0-247c-460b-bb55-f5d1e699b1e7" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Best Practices for OAuth 2.0 in Azure AD</link>.
trans-unit.target: For details, see <link xlink:href="12a33bb0-247c-460b-bb55-f5d1e699b1e7" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Best Practices for OAuth 2.0 in Azure AD</link>.

trans-unit.source: Access Token Request with a Refresh Token
trans-unit.target: Access Token Request with a Refresh Token

trans-unit.source: To use a refresh token to request a new access token, use an HTTP POST request to the common (tenant-independent) or a tenant-specific Azure AD endpoint.
trans-unit.target: To use a refresh token to request a new access token, use an HTTP POST request to the common (tenant-independent) or a tenant-specific Azure AD endpoint.

trans-unit.source: Use the following parameters in a token request that includes a refresh token.
trans-unit.target: Use the following parameters in a token request that includes a refresh token.

trans-unit.source: Parameter
trans-unit.target: Parameter

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: client_id
trans-unit.target: client_id

trans-unit.source: [Optional] The client ID of the native client application that is registered in Azure AD.
trans-unit.target: [Optional] The client ID of the native client application that is registered in Azure AD.

trans-unit.source: To find the application's client ID, in the <externalLink><linkText>Azure Management Portal</linkText><linkUri>https://manage.WindowsAzure.com</linkUri></externalLink>, click <ui>Active Directory</ui>, click the directory, click the application, and then click <ui>Configure</ui>.
trans-unit.target: To find the application's client ID, in the <externalLink><linkText>Azure Management Portal</linkText><linkUri>https://manage.WindowsAzure.com</linkUri></externalLink>, click <ui>Active Directory</ui>, click the directory, click the application, and then click <ui>Configure</ui>.

trans-unit.source: client_secret
trans-unit.target: client_secret

trans-unit.source: [Required for confidential clients (websites)] Contains the client password.
trans-unit.target: [Required for confidential clients (websites)] Contains the client password.

trans-unit.source: grant_type
trans-unit.target: grant_type

trans-unit.source: [Required] Indicates the type of grant being used.
trans-unit.target: [Required] Indicates the type of grant being used.

trans-unit.source: In this case, the value must be <parameterReference>refresh_token</parameterReference>.
trans-unit.target: In this case, the value must be <parameterReference>refresh_token</parameterReference>.

trans-unit.source: refresh_token
trans-unit.target: refresh_token

trans-unit.source: [Required] The refresh token that was included in the response that provided the access token.
trans-unit.target: [Required] The refresh token that was included in the response that provided the access token.

trans-unit.source: resource
trans-unit.target: resource

trans-unit.source: [Optional] The App ID URI of the web API (secured resource).
trans-unit.target: [Optional] The App ID URI of the web API (secured resource).

trans-unit.source: To find the App ID URI, in the <externalLink><linkText>Azure Management Portal</linkText><linkUri>https://manage.WindowsAzure.com</linkUri></externalLink>, click <ui>Active Directory</ui>, click the directory, click the application, and then click <ui>Configure</ui>.
trans-unit.target: To find the App ID URI, in the <externalLink><linkText>Azure Management Portal</linkText><linkUri>https://manage.WindowsAzure.com</linkUri></externalLink>, click <ui>Active Directory</ui>, click the directory, click the application, and then click <ui>Configure</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Examples
trans-unit.target: Examples

trans-unit.source: The following example uses a refresh_token to request a new access token.
trans-unit.target: The following example uses a refresh_token to request a new access token.

trans-unit.source: The POST includes the required <parameterReference>grant_type</parameterReference> and <parameterReference>refresh_token</parameterReference> parameters, but none of the optional parameters.
trans-unit.target: The POST includes the required <parameterReference>grant_type</parameterReference> and <parameterReference>refresh_token</parameterReference> parameters, but none of the optional parameters.

trans-unit.source: Typically, this format is used when the original request specified the resource and there's no need to include it again.
trans-unit.target: Typically, this format is used when the original request specified the resource and there's no need to include it again.

trans-unit.source: The following example shows a request from a confidential client (website).
trans-unit.target: The following example shows a request from a confidential client (website).

trans-unit.source: It includes the <parameterReference>client_id</parameterReference> and <parameterReference>client_secret</parameterReference> parameters
trans-unit.target: It includes the <parameterReference>client_id</parameterReference> and <parameterReference>client_secret</parameterReference> parameters

trans-unit.source: The following example also uses a refresh token to request an access token.
trans-unit.target: The following example also uses a refresh token to request an access token.

trans-unit.source: This request includes the <parameterReference>resource</parameterReference> parameter with a value that indicates the secured resource that the application wants to access.
trans-unit.target: This request includes the <parameterReference>resource</parameterReference> parameter with a value that indicates the secured resource that the application wants to access.

trans-unit.source: Access Token Response with a Refresh Token
trans-unit.target: Access Token Response with a Refresh Token

trans-unit.source: A successful response to an access token request that includes a refresh token includes the following parameters.
trans-unit.target: A successful response to an access token request that includes a refresh token includes the following parameters.

trans-unit.source: Parameter
trans-unit.target: Parameter

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: access_token
trans-unit.target: access_token

trans-unit.source: The new access token that was requested.
trans-unit.target: The new access token that was requested.

trans-unit.source: expires_in
trans-unit.target: expires_in

trans-unit.source: The remaining lifetime of the token in seconds.
trans-unit.target: The remaining lifetime of the token in seconds.

trans-unit.source: A typical value is 3600 (one hour).
trans-unit.target: A typical value is 3600 (one hour).

trans-unit.source: expires_on
trans-unit.target: expires_on

trans-unit.source: The date and time on which the token expires.
trans-unit.target: The date and time on which the token expires.

trans-unit.source: The date is represented as the number of seconds from 1970-01-01T0:0:0Z UTC until the expiration time.
trans-unit.target: The date is represented as the number of seconds from 1970-01-01T0:0:0Z UTC until the expiration time.

trans-unit.source: refresh_token
trans-unit.target: refresh_token

trans-unit.source: A new OAuth 2.0 refresh_token that can be used to request new access tokens when the one in this response expires.
trans-unit.target: A new OAuth 2.0 refresh_token that can be used to request new access tokens when the one in this response expires.

trans-unit.source: resource
trans-unit.target: resource

trans-unit.source: Identifies the secured resource that the access token can be used to access.
trans-unit.target: Identifies the secured resource that the access token can be used to access.

trans-unit.source: scope
trans-unit.target: scope

trans-unit.source: Impersonation permissions granted to the native client application.
trans-unit.target: Impersonation permissions granted to the native client application.

trans-unit.source: The default permission is <embeddedLabel>user_impersonation</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: The default permission is <embeddedLabel>user_impersonation</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: The owner of the target resource can register alternate values in Azure AD.
trans-unit.target: The owner of the target resource can register alternate values in Azure AD.

trans-unit.source: token_type
trans-unit.target: token_type

trans-unit.source: The token type.
trans-unit.target: The token type.

trans-unit.source: The only supported value is <embeddedLabel>bearer</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: The only supported value is <embeddedLabel>bearer</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Examples
trans-unit.target: Examples

trans-unit.source: The following is a sample response to an access token request that includes a refresh token.
trans-unit.target: The following is a sample response to an access token request that includes a refresh token.
